info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 3:48PM EDT until June 16 at 4:30PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Chesterfield County in central Virginia... Northeastern Nottoway County in south central Virginia... Northwestern Dinwiddie County in south central Virginia... Amelia County in central Virginia... Southwestern Powhatan County in central Virginia... * Until 430 PM EDT. * At 348 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Morven, or 9 miles west of Amelia Courthouse, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and ping pong ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Amelia Courthouse around 400 PM EDT. Chula around 405 PM EDT. Scotts Fork around 410 PM EDT. Mannboro around 415 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Winterpock, Earls, Ammon, Pilkinton, Rodophil, Giles Mill, Winterham, Paineville, Skinquarter and Maplewood. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move immediately to shelter inside a strong building. Stay away from windows. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.
